comment: Literally the hardest lab I've ever taken. As someone who gets A's and B's on lab I GOT A C-. She doesn't give any extra credit. If you have social anxiety do not take her she's very loud and will embarrass you. She will kick you out in front of everyone if you're late. She's a very harsh grader and you have to attend EVERY CLASS or else 0?!???
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. Kaledin is knowledgeable; she isn't too harsh of a grader and works with you to help you reach your fullest potential. She encourages people to come to office hours if they have any trouble with the labs. Although her instructions can be a little unclear at times, she will explain things to you clearly if you ask her.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Kaledin was great! She is kind of hard to understand at times and can make you feel slow when asking questions sometimes but I feel it's all out of love. I ended with an 88 in the class and she rounded up to an A. Very caring and will help you a lot for your success. I recommend her! Just do the work on time and you will be fine!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: she is a very enthusiastic professor and sometimes it gets the best of her. she is very knowledgeable and is always down to help. if you cant handle someone being blunt to you i don't suggest at all, would suggest for anyone other then that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: She is so knowledgeable about physical chemistry and is very enthusiastic. The lectures are a bit overwhelming, but if you use office hours and ask questions it really helps you narrow down what you need to know. She is so helpful in office hours and is good at explaining hard concepts. Overall a very good professor, but you need to put in the work
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Worst teacher by far. Take another teacher if possible. she not understanding of her students. She be taking small shots at people in the class and is sometimes rude. Avoid at all cost! No formula sheet as she expect u to memorize 20+ for one exam. Grading scale is curved but that does not help since majority of the class is failing
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Homework is due every other class and don't expect fair grading on those. There are a lot of quizzes in class. No formula sheets on exam she expects students to remember every single formula. The class average was in the 60s and she never did anything to help or change the structure in any way.  Honestly one of my worst classes at KSU
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A LOT of material that can be difficult but never felt overloaded by it. Dr. Kaledin is especially great about giving back grades/feedback so you always know where you stand in the class and what you need to improve on content wise. Never any surprises on exams, only downside of this is that you don't get a formula sheet on them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Kaledin has an accent, but it is easy to manage after the first few days. Come to class prepared beforehand and you should do just fine. She truly cares about her students and is passionate about what she is teaching. She is available whenever you are having trouble with an assignment.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Kaledin lectures very quickly, so I would watch recordings, so that way I could pause and research something I didn't understand, instead of watching her live were she's rushing through material. There is ALOT of material, so try and do a little bit everyday. DO NOT Procrastinate. It can be overwhelming, but hang in there.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This class is one of the most confusing and annoying chemistry courses I have taken thus far. She went really fast in lecture and did not stop, expecting us to rewatch them in the recording. The textbook is not much help since its basically gibberish. Just try using the ppts and youll get by but if there is another professor maybe try them first.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Dr Martina is amazing in what she does, I have cried in her office by the fear I wouldn't be able to pass the class since is a cery hard class. Dr Martina gives very good feedback and she is always willing to help. Her exam reviews are the best, son
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof Kaledin is incredibly smart and passionate about Chemistry. She dives in full speed ahead- she has powerpoint presentations before each lab. She does expect you to get pretty much ALL of the lab hw done before you leave. This made lab a bit long, but she was thorough in explaining everything and really helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: She is very kind, isnt a harsh grader, and will help you if you need it. You cant ask for much more in a Chem2 lab prof
rating_tags: Respected--Caring

comment: Reading these reviews I feel the complete opposite. Dr. Kaledin truly cares about the success of her students. Physical Chemistry is hard but she's clear on what you need to expect for the exams. She gives multiple ways to prep and offers outside sources other than the textbook. If you study and put in the effort, you will do well!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: OK, everyone knows Physical Chemistry is one of the hardest chemistry classes in undergrad, so the bad reviews are probably from students who are lazy. You must WORK for your grade! Dr. Kaledin is brilliant so come prepared and do not get behind because the class moves very very fast! READ THE TEXTBOOK, like actually open it and read it, it helps.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I liked the professor, but I didn't have a good experience with my lab partners. She let me switch. I wish I talked to her sooner about it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Kaledin is a good professor. She is really passionate about what she does. Sometimes, she gets so excited that she jumps ahead of herself and goes a little too fast. Asking more questions helps her pause and slow down. Just pay attention, ask many questions and make connections to other concepts, especially if it's related to physics.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Shes a really nice person but shes an awful professor. She has a thick accent thats hard to understand and she speeds through the material. You basically have to go home and go through her PowerPoints and go to SI sessions to be successful.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: What a chaotic semester. HW was very time intensive, pop quizzes were annoying, and Kaledin's accent made it hard to understand what was going on. HOWEVER, she has a lowered grading scale (A is 88, B is 75, C is 65), and her tests really aren't hard. It's just so much material crammed into 1 semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: DONT BUY THE BOOK! We only used it once for 1 hw problem, so you can take a pic from someone else's book for that. Kaledin herself was a passionate lecturer but often showed too much math. Her pop quizzes were at the first 5 minutes of class, so go to class and GET THERE ON TIME! They were 10% of the grade. Most of the HW was on chegg. Easy C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Had her for gen chem and p chem. Avoid her like the plague for gen chem, but TAKE her for p chem! Her p chem course is more math intensive than it needs to be, and having it at 8 AM made it worse. However, the first exam was gen chem review which will help your grade. Gives pop quizzes and bumps everyone at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Had her for p chem. She's all over the place and barely speaks English, but at the end of the semester she bumped EVERYONE! When I say that I mean everyone failing magically got a C and everyone that was close to an A or B got bumped up. Her grading scale is life saving. A  88, B  75, C  65.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: At first, I wasnt so sure (I am more of a physics person). However, when I asked questions related to physics in chemistry, I got a better understanding of chemistry itself. Over time, I came to really appreciate her. Ask lots of questions, think ahead of where she is going, pair it with SI sessions and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She's very knowledgeable and can answer any question that you may have so that you actually understand what you are doing. She is an easy lab grader. The only lab teacher you should evereverr take.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kaledin is so helpful during labs, She will help you get an A. I would take her again in a heartbeat. Caring and helpful to all students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria

comment: Don't do it! You won't understand her, some of the brightest students take this class and struggle.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Kaledin is a professor that truly knows their content. However, I go to the SI sessions that go with the class, to me, the only way I am making an A. Tests are MC 30 questions and have a curve. Sometimes goes on tangents. Sometimes difficult to understand and somewhat old school. Very respectable. Has short pop quizzes though :/
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I had to withdraw from this class. The professor has a very strong accent and talks very fast. When she does examples on the board she goes very fast as well and stands in front of it as she writes, then when she's done, she lets you see it for a second then erases it quickly. She also only gives you five minutes to do pop quizzes. Do not take her
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Such a hard class. I struggled a lot. I took advanced chemistry in high school and this class was tough. Professor Kaledin is a nice lady, but everyone i know who was in my class didn't do well either. There are better chemistry professors at KSU i would recommend instead.

Class isn't mandatory as long as you do the homework, however sometimes she has pop quizzes and the homework takes forever. Exams are easy if you go through her lecture slides at least once. Her teaching style is a bit scattered; she expected us to learn at home like a flipped classroom, so the lectures didn't really make sense.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Good teacher. Would take her again. Attendance not mandatory, but recommended if you want a good grade.

Prof. Kaledin does have a slight accent, but it's not hard to understand her at all. She is always there to answer questions and is very encouraging. She can be strict with time so don't be late! No tests except the final, just online quizzes (not hard) and lab assignments. Be sure to ask questions and complete as soon as you can. Not too hard.

Great professor. Really knows her stuff but has an accent. Unfortunately she's very hard to understand and expects you to come into the class already knowing a good bit about chemistry. She tries to help but is just not very clear and doesn't seem to understand what you're asking her. Just follow the syllabus and show up and you should do alright.

Dr. Kaledin was a great professor for p-chem. P-chem is a hard class and she made it bearable. Offers extra credit on all tests and on quizzes too if I remember correctly. I took her 1 day a week 3 hour lecture so it was long but she gave us a break halfway through class. If you pay attention and do all your work you'll be fine. I managed an A.

I took her for Chem 1211L. The labs were fun! If you struggled to understand something she tries her best to explain it although occasionally it was hard to understand her. You can tell she takes pride in Chemistry and loves her students. She grades the labs very fairly not taking off many points. Gives you formulas to every lab. Would recommend!

Its a hard class but all the chem classes are hard. GO TO CLASS. You wont pass if you skip. Do all the homework. Its a lot but not overly hard. Take the practice tests for the test. If you know someone who does well in chem cling onto them. She really does want to help, but you have to ask if you dont understand.

Professor Kaledin is an amazing professor. Her accent is not bad at all. This is a beginner chemistry class, which means it is all material you probably covered in a U.S. high school AND middle school. She gives informative and helpful lectures full of examples, concepts, and explanations. GO TO CLASS, take notes. I got a 102. Just go to class.

Dr. Kaledin is such an intelligent and sweet woman, but she is not the best professor. If you are good at chemistry, definitely take her for an easy A, if not take another professor. She has trouble trying to explain things in simple terms. She really wants to see you succeed though, so if you need extra help just go to her during her office hours.
She is extremely confusing and does not speak in English clearly. The class work and the tests are not incredibly difficult if you study by yourself, but her lectures are not helpful at all

Don't take her class unless you are good at chemistry. She is very intelligent, but almost too much so. Her teaching style is reading off of a power point and she moves very fast. Its almost like her class is designed for people who already have an understanding of chem. I am not great at chemistry so I really really struggled.
I took her class at 2013 spring semester. Actually, I went the class only 5 times to take exam. She will give a lot extra credit and her a lot of home work will greatly help you. Must take her class

Before taking this class I read horrible things about her. Yes she is EXTREMELY hard to understand but she gives extra credit oppurtunites and such. I puchased the text book and never used it. The online OWL homework was greatly helpful to me. I taught myself pretty much. I recieved an A, Just don't be lazy an you'll be fine.

Professor Kaledin is such a sweet lady, but not exactly the best professor. Her accent is very difficult to understand, especially because she rushes through things. Only take her if you are already good at chemistry.

Sweet lady with a thick accent. She truly does want to help you understand the class, so feel free to ask questions & attend office hours. She goes very fast with her lectures, makes it kinda difficult to keep up. Owl assignments are very helpful. Complete Owl & attend all classes, you should do fine.

Had her for Chem 1211. This is not an easy class, you will have to work hard and study! Goes through the material very quickly. She is very intelligent. Doesn't use the book, but I would recommend using it for the test. Attendance isn't mandatory. There are 4 tests, she drops the lowest. Homework is online. She is very helpful and nice.

I had her for General Chemistry I. She goes through the material very fast and if you ask a question she makes you feel dumb. I would not recommend. I could not understand her and it made that class extremely hard.

Goes very fast through the material becuase she knows it so well. Hard to ask questions becuase she just goes right through the power points in class. Has an accent, sometimes hard to understand. Only gives 4 tests and a final, drops lowest test grade. No extra credit oppurtunities except for a survey, doesnt use the book but helps for test.
all over the place. a little confusing which makes it hard to keep up with what she's trying to teach.

Recommend this proffesor. Her accent is very heavy, but she answers email fast. very helpful. Hw on owl was helful, tests are simple questions and she goes through alot of examples. I had to read to the book, but her quizes, hw, extra credit helps out on grade.Final was a standardized exam with a curve of more then 10 points.

She is hard to understand.  She goes way too fast and people literally stop coming to class because she confuses more than she clarifies.  She is nice and tries to help, but she is so educated that it is hard for her to come down to a pre-nursing level chemistry class.  You will have to pretty much teach yourself or hire tutors.  Pick someone else.
She knows her stuff. This is a difficult subject, but she does an OK job at explaining. She jumps topics or speeds thru some concepts sometimes. The OWL hw helps! Overall an OK teacher...

She has an accent but is extremely useful and she uses a lot of examples that will be used on the test. Tests are all multiple choice which makes it easier. She has pop quizzes which encourages students to attend and there is a lot of work to do on OWL.

Dr. Kaledin is a great professor. Her class setup is great and there are plenty of homework assignments and quizzes to supplement your grade. She can be hard to understand sometimes with her accent. She is extremely helpful if you go to her office and is willing to help you. Overall a wonderful professor to take.

I liked her.  She was difficult to understand because she has an accent, but overall she is very smart.  Her tests are very easy, all you have to do is study the powerpoints she posts and you will do just fine.  I say it was an easy A.

She has an accent, but you can understand her very well! she is  a very accomplished chemist, who knows exactly what she is talking about. i learned so much from her and she made me love Chemistry again! Take HER :) you will get an A if you study the material, read your book, and come to class!

I had her for Chem 1212 Lab. She was a very lenient grader. Course content was very hard, but with the way she grades, it is very easy to get an A in the class. She's very enthusiastic about chemistry, and it's obvious she enjoys her job very much. She has a very strong accent, but she's easy to understand. I would definitely recommend her for lab!

She loves chemistry. Likes to study it in her spare time. If you go most of the time and pay attention and make sure you get the math parts of chem you can get an A. I had an A until the final. The final is an 1995 Standardized Test which is nothing like what or how she is teaching.  Overall, try to get high A to counteract the final.

I find her accent easy to understand. It helps to follow lecture if you read chapter beforehand but that's true of all classes. Her tests are fair, very similar to quizzes and materials she covers. If you don't do this well in this class, you only have yourself to blame.

I had her for 1211 Lab and she is a good lab teacher. She gives very short pre labs and made an already easy class even easier. She is incredibly hard to understand since she is from Slovokia but she is a very nice person. If you pay attention in lecture, you should be fine in lab. Just dont take her for lecture because her accent is so bad.

She is very intelligent and enthusiastic about chem BUT she should NOT be teaching an intro class. She goes way too fast and is not available after class for help. She also teaches more chapters than needed and many other advanced concepts and formulas are introduced unnessisarily. Her lectures are hard to follow.

Attendence is not mandatory but I highly reccomend it. She gives lots of extra credit opportunities for those who do show up to class. You must be a good independent studier, plan on teaching yourself. The online quizes can be made easy the real killer of this class are the tests. Memorise the material and you will make an A.

Excellent teacher.If u find this teacher difficult,you are in the wrong clas.She give u every opportunity to make an A.Even damn asses who have no business taking chemistry have a descent shot with this teacher.As for the nonsense about her ascent, well u are in collage and should be able to understand different ascents.Made  an A without a sweat

She has an extremely heavy accent which made the class extremely hard. The tests weren't that bad but if you don't really know chemistry, then don't take this teacher! You won't be able to learn anything!

She does have a very strong accent which can make it very difficult to understand lectures. She moves kind of fast and sometimes it's hard to get her attention to ask a question. Her tests are straight from the online quizzes so look over those and you'll do fine. She really does want her students to pass, but you have to work

I had her for FALL. Apart from her accent she is really good. She gives easy online quizzes and her tests are identical to the quizzes she just switches the order. She gives extra credit at the beginning of the semester also and she curves the final which does help alot. She also gives review sheets. She does not pay attention to attendance.

DONT bother going to class, you CANNOT understand her!! Lectures ONLY confuse you! just read the text and study the quizzes- almost all test questions are from the quizzes! difficult course but if you work really hard you can get an A. I would never take her class again!

Besides her accent, she is a great teacher. She knows what she is teaching and she is very helpful. She has given lots of bonus points to the class. If you take time to study for her class, you will do well.

Very very hard to understand and unclear. Your better off not going to class and using the time to read the textbook yourself. Study quizzes, they help for tests. Tutoring in the library helped more than going to class. Speeds through class and power points. I would never take a class taught by her again. Good luck!

She doesnt speak english and it gets annoying after a while listening to the accent. Study the quizzes online and you will be OK. READ THE TEXT!!!!!... it will help allot! you can manage the course if you're willing to work for it. i got an A and i worked hard for it!

So hard to understand that it was normal for only about 20 out of 70 students to attend lecture classes. Youll get by if you study the quizzes and notes she puts online. I definitely would not have done well if I had not remembered so much from my past chemistry class in high school...good luck...
Hard to understand!

She is a great teacher. Sometimes she will mixes up words, because English isnt her first language. Power points online, so take notes before getting to class then add into them with practice problems she does and a quiz per chapter. She puts worksheets and other helpful things on her website. She is willing to explain things again if you ask.

I'd seen her rating prior to taking this class but decided to ignore the negative comments. I should've listened. She knows her subject well but she's difficult to understand, speeds through the course and gives no regard to students who don't understand her instruction. Don't take her class if you want to pass! Reading the textbook proved better.
she explains everything very well....she knows what the material is about....she is very helpful when you ask for her help....dont miss class because it will kill your grade....amazing lab professor
She drops the lowest lab grade, but do not miss class, it will hurt your grade.
Good/Faie/But Hard  from Sovakia

For the chem 1211L she is probly the best teacher u can have. very laid back. VERY nice. and really wants you to understand the subject. Make sure your nice to her, because she will be equaly nice to you in return. Chem lab isnt very hard to begin with, but with her, you sail right through. Great teacher.

A hard to understand professor on an already difficult subject. She has a hard time explaining things, very confusing class you'll get lost very easily within a few minutes into the lecture. Goes very fast and even if she explains things, it's still very hard to understand. Dont take this professor if you want to get an A in this class.

Kaledin-Very nice person but lacks teaching skills.People in the class have a very hard time understanding the material because is she very hard to understand and she zooms past all the material in seconds.The lecture is very boring overall and by the final, you really aren't prepared.The average on the final was 45/100. not good! Reflects on her.

AS IF THE SUBJECT WASN'T HARD ENOUGH YOU CAN'T UNDERSTAND A WORD SHE SAYS. WHEN YOU ASK HER QUESTIONS SHE DOESN'T UNDERSTAND WHAT YOU ARE SAYING. DOES NO CURVING EVEN THOUGH THE CLASS AVERAGE WAS A 45.
